channel.title: CVE Feed for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache James
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache James

item.title: CVE-2022-22931|2024-08-03T03:28:42.456Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20james
item.description: Fix of CVE-2021-40525 do not prepend delimiters upon valid directory validations. Affected implementations include: - maildir mailbox store - Sieve file repository This enables a user to access other users data stores (limited to user names being prefixed by the value of the username being used).

item.title: CVE-2022-28220|2024-08-03T05:48:37.476Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20james
item.description: Apache James prior to release 3.6.3 and 3.7.1 is vulnerable to a buffering attack relying on the use of the STARTTLS command. Fix of CVE-2021-38542, which solved similar problem fron Apache James 3.6.1, is subject to a parser differential and do not take into account concurrent requests.
